title: WCAS PHIL 267-0-20 Philosophy, Race, and Racism

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will explore the metaphysics and ethics of race. We will ask questions concerning: what the term "race" means; how old the concept of race is; whether races exist and, if so, what kind of things they are; whether it is valuable to acknowledge and embrace one's racial identity; and what counts as racism.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will be expected to be able to differentiate between the major positions on the metaphysics of race, to evaluate them, and to take positions on what counts as racism.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Paul C. Taylor, Race: A Philosophical Introduction, 2nd ed. (Cambridge, UK: Polity Press, 2013). ISBN: 978-0-7456-4965-8
